description.narrative: - Maintain and create jobs in the growing retail sector: The Group''s retail business currently employs 5,300 employees and the Project is expected to create significant jobs as the Company increases capacity. Majority of the workforce is expected to be employed from the local communities thereby contributing to community development. - Improvement in the quality of life and fostering inclusive growth: The Project will contribute towards bringing better quality food products at low prices to post conflict areas in Sri Lanka thereby fostering better life quality and inclusive growth across socio-economic strata. - Development of local supply chains: The Project would increase the number of and volumes from local suppliers, provide additional sales channels for local producers and importers and effectively contribute towards strengthening the retail eco-system relating to efficiencies and operating standards. - Increase in farmer reach: The Company procures fresh produce from 8,000 farmers across the country on a daily basis at a fixed price leading to predictable demand and pricing for farmers. The Project is expected to increase its reach to farmers through increased demand for end products.

Cargills Foods Company (Private) Limited (CFPL / Company) plans to raise upto US$20 million from IFC through a primary purchase of shares of CFPL. In addition to capitalizing the Company, the proceeds are expected to be partly utilized to fund the expansion of the Companys retail business and partly utilized for pay down of debt by CFPL.
